summary: This document is a series of training attendance rosters for staff at the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) New York for FY-2019. It covers multiple training sessions on topics like correctional procedures, whistleblower rights, sexual abuse prevention (PREA), firearms qualification, and other operational subjects. The document is significant as it shows routine administrative and training operations at the facility where Jeffrey Epstein was later held, but it contains no direct references to Epstein, his case, or any related individuals.

events.title: MCC New York Annual Training Session
events.description: Correctional training sessions held at 26 Federal Plaza covering topics including reporting wrongdoing, whistleblower rights, weapons of mass destruction, and continuity of operations.

locations: 26 Federal Plaza, 6th Floor, Classroom J, New York
26 Federal Plaza, 6th Floor, Classroom I, New York
keyFacts: Document shows routine staff training at MCC New York in March-April 2019, covering standard correctional topics.
Training included PREA (Prison Rape Elimination Act) compliance, sexual abuse/harassment policies, and whistleblower protections.
Firearms qualification records show staff training with various weapons (9mm, M16, 12GA) at FCI Danbury.
No named individuals from the Epstein case appear in these training attendance rosters.
The document is administrative in nature and does not reference Jeffrey Epstein, his associates, or the circumstances of his incarceration.
